CVE.summary: The SSLv2 implementation in OpenSSL before 0.9.8zf, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0r, 1.0.1 before 1.0.1m, and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2a allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (s2_lib.c assertion failure and daemon exit) via a crafted CLIENT-MASTER-KEY message.

vFeed.Product: vFeed - The Correlated Vulnerability and Threat Database
vFeed.Author: NJ OUCHN

Oval.title: AIX OpenSSL Denial of Service (assertion failure and daemon exit)

Potential security vulnerabilities have been identified with HP-UX running OpenSSL.
							These vulnerabilities could be exploited remotely to create a remote Denial of Service
							(DoS) and other vulnerabilites.
